channel.title: Stan for cognitive science
channel.description: Recent content on Stan for cognitive science

item.title: Books and tutorials using Stan
item.description: Books Bayesian Cognitive Modeling: A Practical Course (2014) by Michael Lee and Eric-Jan Wagenmakers. Stan code available Statistical rethinking: A Bayesian course with examples in R and Stan (2020) by Richard McElreath An Introduction to Bayesian Data Analysis for Cognitive Science (in progress) by Bruno Nicenboim, Daniel Schad, and Shravan Vasishth Online tutorials and case studies Dablander, F. Bayesian Estimation of Signal Detection Models. 2017. URL: https://vuorre.netlify.app/post/2017/10/09/bayesian-estimation-of-signal-detection-theory-models-part-1/. Dablander, F.

item.title: Papers using Stan
item.description: Papers using Stan (or brms, rstanarm) 2020 Nicenboim, B, S. Vasishth, and F. Rösler(2020).“Are words pre-activated probabilistically during sentence comprehension? Evidence from new data and a Bayesian random-effects meta-analysis using publicly available data”.In: Neuropsychologia. In press.DOI: 10.1016/j.neuropsychologia.2020.107427.eprint: https://psyarxiv.com/2atrh/. Lisson, P., D. Pregla, B. Nicenboim, D. Paape, M. L. van hetNederend, F. Burchert, N. Stadie, D. Caplan, and S. Vasishth(2020).“A computational evaluation of two models of retrieval processes in sentence processing in aphasia”.
